Comment: I started with natural intentions to create a 4-move checkmate.
He opened commonly with a mirrored move.
I continued my mating intentions.
He hadn't quite seen through me yet.
I gambled to go for the obvious one.
Caught.
I dropped back, still in position, hoping he wouldn't notice I was still a threat.
A common defense at this point in the 4-move checkmate.
I opened up to sacrifice a bishop for a mate.
He planned a move that I saw coming.
I sacrificed...
Denied. Now I have to return the favor.
I took the trade.
And now I couldn't defend it. Unstoppable at this point.
I Tried to capture the knight for revenge after he killed my rook.
He is now stuck in place.
I moved out my knight, to catch the bishop's attention. That way, I could silently assassinate the enemy knight later.
My plan was working so far.
I allowed for time.
He ignored, still, my attention grabbing plan.
